item.title: Michigan Man Follows Intuition to Become Hero in Live-Saving Rescue
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
A Michigan man on a Canada fishing trip noticed debris strewn on the side of the road leading to an embankment and almost kept going. But two miles down the road he decided to turn around and investigate. He found a car with two children passengers screaming as the vehicle

item.title: The Harvard Graduate Finding Tech Jobs for World’s Poorest People
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
A Harvard graduate has started a non-profit organization to find low-level tech jobs for the world’s poorest citizens. Leila Janah started Samasource—Sama is Sanskrit for “equal”—as an outsourcing company that hires people in Africa and Asia to perform digital tasks for companies like AOL, Ebay and Google. “It was important to me

The post The Harvard Graduate Finding Tech Jobs for World’s Poorest People appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Ebola Vaccine Trial Proves 100% Successful in Guinea
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
A vaccine against Ebola has been shown to be 100% successful in trials conducted during the outbreak in Guinea and is likely to bring the west African epidemic to an end, the Guardian reported Friday. Scientists, doctors, donors and drug companies collaborated to race the vaccine through a process that

The post Ebola Vaccine Trial Proves 100% Successful in Guinea appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Keep On Livin,’ a Stranger Told Me After a Sweet Encounter
item.dc:creator: DJ King
item.description:

item.title: Good News in History, August 2
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:

item.title: World’s Largest Free Kitchen Feeds 100,000 a Day Inside a Golden Temple
item.dc:creator: Sheila Key
item.description:
Feeding the hungry is a time-honored tradition among people of many faiths, all over the world. In Amritsar, India, the Sikh gather in a Golden Temple to serve 100,000 meals every single day of the year in a kitchen that never closes. The langar, or community kitchen, found in this temple is the

The post World’s Largest Free Kitchen Feeds 100,000 a Day Inside a Golden Temple appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Entire Nation of Sri Lanka Will Soon Get Internet Access Thanks to Google
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
The entire island nation of Sri Lanka is about to be blanketed with Internet service — all of it beamed from balloons – thanks to a contract with Google to create Internet connections in the sky. Google’s Project Loon uses a network of 13 giant balloons, riding air currents, to deliver smartphone-based

The post Entire Nation of Sri Lanka Will Soon Get Internet Access Thanks to Google appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Watch What 1000 Passionate Italians Did to Lure a Rockstar to Their Town (MUST SEE)
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
They say music brings us together and although this performance only lasted four minutes, its epic orchestration brought together 1000 drummers, bassists, singers and guitarists united in a single plea–directed at five guys. “Please come and play for us in Cesena, Italy.” Fabio Zaffagnini worked a year on producing the

item.title: Family Finds 300-yo Golden Treasure in Shallow Florida Waters
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
Within days of the anniversary that a Spanish fleet wrecked in a hurricane off the coast of Florida 300 years ago, a family of treasure divers uncovered a million dollars in rare gold coins and artifacts hiding in just 15 feet of water. 1,000 feet off the coast of Fort Pierce, Eric Schmitt and his family

The post Family Finds 300-yo Golden Treasure in Shallow Florida Waters appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Good News in History, August 1
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
On this day 44 years ago, the groundbreaking Concert For Bangladesh was held at New York’s Madison Square Garden. Organized by George Harrison to aid victims of famine and war, the concert, which may have been the first all-star charity rock show, featured Bob Dylan, Eric Clapton, Ringo Starr, Leon

The post Good News in History, August 1 appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Firefighters Pay it Forward Big Time After Waitress With Heart of Gold Picks Up Tab
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
A waitress who did a good deed for a pair of firefighters was overwhelmed when they returned the favor—for her father. Instead of a bill for their breakfast, Liz Woodward brought a pair of New Jersey firefighters a thank you note—they’d just spent the night battling a blaze at a

item.title: Canadians Can Now Use Frequent Flyer Miles To Pay For College
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
If you happen to live in Canada, you can take a year off to travel the world before college and use those frequent flyer miles to pay your tuition. Thanks to a team effort by Air Canada’s frequent flyer program, Aeroplan, and HigherEdPoints, miles can now be converted into education

The post Canadians Can Now Use Frequent Flyer Miles To Pay For College appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: 11 Species of Chameleon Could Save Rainforest—Bonus: Watch One Pop Bubbles
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
Of course 11 species of color-changing lizards have been hiding in plain sight — they’re masters of disguise. Now that they’ve officially been discovered, scientists believe the critters could actually help save a rainforest. Panther chameleons, who are native to Madagascar, were initially thought to be a single species. Scientist

The post 11 Species of Chameleon Could Save Rainforest—Bonus: Watch One Pop Bubbles appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: After Korean War Monument is Vandalized in NJ, a South Korean Town Donates to Repair it
item.dc:creator: Sheila Key
item.description:
Sixty-two years after the Korean War ended, residents of a South Korean town reached out to veterans in New Jersey to remind them that their sacrifice in the 1950s will never be forgotten. A refurbished monument that honors local veterans of the Asian conflict was unveiled Monday in Jersey City,

The post After Korean War Monument is Vandalized in NJ, a South Korean Town Donates to Repair it appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: This is the 10th Summer Warren Buffett Has Donated Over $1Bil to Charity
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
Warren Buffett’s summer tradition of giving continued with a gift of $2.8 billion to foundations that work on global health, college scholarships, poverty and opportunities for children, especially girls, around the world. The billionaire’s latest donation was given in the form of 20.6 million shares of Berkshire Hathaway stock divided

The post This is the 10th Summer Warren Buffett Has Donated Over $1Bil to Charity appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: How Mervin the Rescue Chihuahua Melted 30,000 Hearts on Instagram
item.dc:creator: Helaina Hovitz
item.description:
Aside from being absolutely adorable—and the ideal posterboy for #TongueOutTuesday—Mervin is a champion for second chance pups everywhere. Initially found as a stray and brought to the ASPCA, Mervin, a very special-needs dog, has made a major splash all over social media. After being properly nourished, undergoing knee surgery, and

The post How Mervin the Rescue Chihuahua Melted 30,000 Hearts on Instagram appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Good News in History, July 31
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
Happy 50th Birthday to J.K. Rowling, the author who also gave the same birth date to her most famous wizard–the “young” Harry Potter who startlingly turns 35 today. Rowling went from a single mom supported by welfare to the world’s first female billionaire novelist. Her artful wizarding fantasy became the

item.title: Sassy 5-yo Sets Up Ice Cream Shop So He Can Buy Medicine for Sick Kids
item.dc:creator: Helaina Hovitz
item.description:
For his fifth birthday, Haylen Astalos’s parents threw him a “five for five party.” They asked guests to bring two $5 dollar bills: one for the birthday boy, and another for him to donate to a charity of his choice. After buying a tricked-out monster truck for himself, Haylen decided to

item.title: Beat This: Watch As Australian Solves Rubik’s Cube in Less than 6 Seconds
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
How fast can you solve a Rubik’s Cube? The reigning world champ did it in 5.695 seconds — that’s a decimal point, not a comma. Feliks Zemdegs took less than six seconds to line up all the colors on all six sides of the classic puzzle during the Rubik’s Cube

item.title: Man Who Donated Son’s Organs Years Ago Gets Same Gift From Recipient’s Mom
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
The gift of life that was given ten years ago is being paid back by a grateful mother to a now-ailing father. In 2005, Bill Millard and his wife decided to donate their son’s organs when he died in an accident. That donation saved the life of fellow San Francisco,

The post Man Who Donated Son’s Organs Years Ago Gets Same Gift From Recipient’s Mom appeared first on Good News Network.
